intro: Galium venosum, commonly known as nettleleaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in cymes, and its leaves are usually heart-shaped with a hairy texture. Galium venosum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
